docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 -- The new "Committee of 20" that will negotiate reform of the world monetary system held its first meeting today and, despite United States opposition, elected a Briton, Jeremy Morse, an executive director of the Bank of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 -- The new "Committee of 20" that will negotiate reform of the world monetary system held its first meeting today and, despite United States opposition, elected a Briton, Jeremy Morse, an executive director of the Bank of England, to the key post of chairman of the "deputies" who will do the hard negotiating.

headline.main: BRITON IS ELECTED TO KEY I.M.F. POST; U. S. Had Supported Ossola, to Head the Deputies Who Will Do the Negotiating

docs.snippet: Dr. Tomaso Bosi of Castel Bolognese is a big man in the dog show world in Italy. The 6-footer is an international judge, one of the top boxer breeders and the state veterinarian for Ravenna.

docs.snippet: Twenty-year-old Henrique Mecking of Brazil won the recent South American Zonal Tournament scoring 17 points out of 20. He thus qualified for the International Tournament to be held next year, the next step in the eliminations that lead eventually to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-year-old Henrique Mecking of Brazil won the recent South American Zonal Tournament scoring 17 points out of 20. He thus qualified for the International Tournament to be held next year, the next step in the eliminations that lead eventually to the world championship.

headline.main: Chess: 20-Year-Old Brazilian Wins The South American Zonal

docs.snippet: The formal imposition of censorship, or other moves toward restraints on the presentation of news, have gained strength this year in major Latin-American countries, according to an Associated Press survey taken before next week's meeting in Chile of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The formal imposition of censorship, or other moves toward restraints on the presentation of news, have gained strength this year in major Latin-American countries, according to an Associated Press survey taken before next week's meeting in Chile of the Inter-American Press Association.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 16 -- Eight Latin-American countries supported Chile in a joint declaration today in her denunciation of the action of the French court.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 16 -- Eight Latin-American countries supported Chile in a joint declaration today in her denunciation of the action of the French court.
docs.abstract: 8 Latin Amer countries on Oct 16 issue joint declaration of support for Chile in her denunciation of French ct's action in blocking payment for her copper; statement, while not specifically mentioning ct order obtained by Kennecott Copper Corp, affirms nation's right to 'freely dispose of its natural resources'; statement is presented to bd of UN Trade and Development Conf, Geneva, by reprs of Argentina, Colombia, Ecuador, Guatemala, Mexico, Peru, Uruguay and Venezuela

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Oct. 20 -- Jewish sources said here tonight that 60 more Soviet Jewish families have been told that they can emigrate to Israel without paying the high exit-visa taxes that Soviet authorities set earlier this fall.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Oct. 20 -- Jewish sources said here tonight that 60 more Soviet Jewish families have been told that they can emigrate to Israel without paying the high exit-visa taxes that Soviet authorities set earlier this fall.
docs.abstract: Jewish sources in Moscow rept on Oct 20 that 60 more Soviet Jewish families have been told they can emigrate to Israel without paying high exit visa fees; 6 other families were reptd informed that they would have to pay tax; no explanation for apparent inconsistency is given; Soviet press agency Tass carries dispatch quoting Soviet supporters in Montevideo, Uruguay, as defending tax; majority of prominent Moscow Jewish activists have apparently been unaffected so far by waiving of taxes

headline.main: Soviet Said to Waive Exit Fee for 60 Jewish Families
